title: When India sent a ₹6 crore bill for the annexation of Hyderabad
description: The Indian Army’s ‘police action’ was brief because it had been meticulously set in motion for over six months; The decision to make Hyderabad foot the bill for its own annexation was both symbolic and practical. Practical, in that it relieved India’s strained Central budget during the chaos of Partition and war in Kashmir

title: Solar Eclipse 2025: When is Surya Grahan--on 20, 21, or 23 September?
description: The final solar eclipse of 2025, a partial one, is set to occur on September 21st, coinciding with the September equinox. This celestial event will be primarily visible in the Southern Hemisphere, offering spectacular views in New Zealand, parts of eastern Australia, and Antarctica. Observers in these regions will witness the Moon partially obscure the Sun, creating a crescent glow.

Critics condemn the action as cruel, warning it will cost lives and hinder global health progress.

Asia Cup | 'Not going to play Pak': IPL chairman makes position clear
description: Arun Dhumal, IPL chairman, affirmed India's commitment to playing Pakistan only in ACC/ICC events, adhering to government policy amidst Asia Cup boycott call. This decision follows heightened tensions after a terrorist attack in Pahalgam, leading to military action. Couple of months ago, Dhumal also managed a crisis during the IPL when PBKS' match in Dharamsala was halted before the league was paused.

title: 'Good he is going': Rahul welcomes PM Modi's Manipur visit; raises 'vote chori' issue
description: Rahul Gandhi acknowledged Prime Minister Modi's upcoming Manipur visit, highlighting the ongoing ethnic clashes. However, he shifted focus to allegations of "vote theft" in Haryana and Maharashtra, claiming widespread public distrust. Modi's visit to Manipur, his first since the violence, aims to address the crisis with development projects and meetings with displaced families from both Kuki and Meitei communities.

title: YouTube expands multi-language audio to millions of creators
description: YouTube is expanding its multi-language audio to millions of creators so that they can make use of multi-lingual dubbing

title: Ciara opens up on Russell Wilson inspiring a dying boy to fight for life and beat cancer
description: Ciara recounted how Russell Wilson's heartfelt conversation inspired a teenager battling leukemia to pursue stem cell therapy, ultimately saving his life. Wilson shared his personal experience of losing his father, instilling hope in the young patient. This act exemplifies the mission of their Why Not You Foundation, which aims to empower children facing adversity to dream big and embrace resilience.

Wayanad tragedy: Congress leader Jose Nelledam found dead; suspected suicide
description: Congress leader Jose Nelledam, a member of the Mullankolli Grama Panchayat in Wayanad, was discovered dead in a pond near his residence on Friday. Kerala police reports suggest he allegedly cut his wrist after consuming poison before jumping into the water. He was rushed to a hospital but was declared dead.

title: Now, Bombay HC receives bomb threat email; hearings suspended, building evacuated
description: Bombay High Court faced a bomb threat via email, leading to immediate evacuation. Hearings were suspended as police and bomb squads searched the complex. Delhi High Court also received a similar threat earlier that day. Authorities are conducting thorough searches at both locations. Recent threats targeted various Mumbai establishments. Officials assured the public that there is no need to panic.

title: 2020 Delhi riots case: SC to hear bail pleas of accused Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam, Gulshifa Fathima, others on Sept 19

'Warped mentality’: BJP fumes over AI video of PM Modi, his mother; Cong reacts
description: The BJP has strongly criticized Congress for an AI-generated video that allegedly mocks Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his late mother, Heeraben. BJP leaders accuse Congress of deliberately insulting PM Modi's mother, while Congress defends the video, stating it contains no disrespect. The controversy arises amidst ongoing political tensions, with both parties exchanging accusations and counter-arguments.

title: Asia Cup: IPL franchise boycotts India vs Pakistan in unique manner; match on Sept 14
description: As India gears up to face Pakistan in the Asia Cup 2025, the match faces controversy due to terrorism concerns, exemplified by Punjab Kings' social media silence on Pakistan. A Supreme Court plea to cancel the match, citing recent terror attacks and the morale of armed forces, was denied. The clash sparks debate about sports and politics amidst strained relations.

IIM Ahmedabad vs IIM Bangalore: Who leads among top B-schools on placements?
description: IIM Ahmedabad retains the top NIRF 2025 rank, but IIM Bangalore edges ahead in placements. With a higher median salary of ₹32.5 lakh and a perfect placement record, Bangalore outshines Ahmedabad’s ₹31 lakh. While Ahmedabad leads in academics and research, Bangalore dominates in recruiter perception and compensation, making the choice between India’s premier B-schools one of priorities.

'You added spice': SC on Kangana's post during farmers' protest
description: The Supreme Court criticized Kangana Ranaut for adding her own commentary to a retweet concerning the 2020-21 farmers' protests, leading her to withdraw her plea seeking to quash a defamation complaint. The court suggested she pursue alternative remedies in the trial court. The case stems from Ranaut's remarks about a woman protester, which the complainant alleges were defamatory.

title: 'What is going on?': Gukesh keeps losing, Sarin keeps winning - Indian chess confronts Janus paradox
description: At the FIDE Grand Swiss in Samarkand, Indian chess presents a contrasting picture. Nihal Sarin shines, securing his third consecutive win and joining the lead. Meanwhile, World Champion D Gukesh struggles, losing his third straight game and risking a drop from the top 10. Despite Nihal's success, he humbly credits Viswanathan Anand and Gukesh for India's chess boom.

description: CBSE has released the 2025 schedule for Class 10 and 12 LOC submissions, private candidate forms, and CWSN exam exemptions. Schools get partial APAAR ID relief, allowing entries as “REFUSED” or “NOGEN” where applicable. Key deadlines range from August 29 to October 11, 2025. Students and schools must follow CBSE’s updated guidelines for error-free submissions.

The viral video showcases Bombi affectionately cuddling Peter, who wears a striped coat to mimic a zebra's pattern, aiding in her natural bonding and preventing over-attachment.

title: 'No words left': Man seeing cheering during Charlie Kirk assassination
description: A video has surfaced showing a man celebrating near the scene of Charlie Kirk's assassination at Utah Valley University. The man, seen pumping his fists and shouting "USA! USA! USA!", has sparked outrage online. While his identity remains unverified, an X account claiming to be him denies celebrating the killing, stating his actions were to draw attention for security to escape.

description: In a horrific incident, a Dallas motel manager, Chandra Nagamallaiah, was beheaded by Yordanis Cobos-Martinez after an argument over a broken washing machine. Manipur sees clashes ahead of PM Modi's visit; security tightened
description: In Manipur's Churachandpur district, miscreants clashed with security forces, vandalizing banners and barricades erected for Prime Minister Modi's upcoming visit. The incidents occurred at Pearsonmun village and Phailien Bazar, where items were set ablaze and stones were thrown. Paramilitary forces have since increased patrols to restore order as Modi is scheduled to unveil projects worth Rs 8,500 crore.

'Charlie Kirk could have been president someday': Trump
description: President Trump expressed deep sorrow over Charlie Kirk's assassination at Utah University, revealing his belief that the right-wing activist had the potential to become president. Trump, during a call with CNBC's Joe Kernen, shared his devastation and praised Kirk's contributions, particularly in the last election. He also mentioned speaking with Kirk's widow, Erika, and indicated progress in the investigation, vowing to bring the "animal" responsible to justice.

Bathed after murder: Hyderabad woman tortured for locker code, hit with cooker
description: In a horrifying incident in Hyderabad, two domestic helps allegedly murdered 50-year-old Renu Agarwal, driven by greed to obtain the password to her digital locker. The assailants brutally tortured her, using a pressure cooker, knife, and scissors, before fleeing with stolen gold and cash.

title: Panchayat chief, drunk at wheel, mows down whistleblower
description: Samalapuram town panchayat president S Vinayaga Palanisamy has been arrested for allegedly running over K Palanisamy, a daily wager, with his SUV. The victim had previously complained about the president's misuse of panchayat funds to lay a private road. Police investigation revealed that Vinayaga Palanisamy, who was allegedly drunk, intentionally hit K Palanisamy, who died later in hospital.

title: Stop calling Mumbai ‘Bombay’ or ‘Bambai’ on your show, MNS warns Kapil Sharma
description: The Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) has cautioned comedian Kapil Sharma against referring to Mumbai as "Bombay" or "Bambai" on his show. MNS leader Ameya Khopkar warned of a strong agitation if Sharma continues to "insult" the city by using its former names.

title: Who is Matthew Dowd? MSNBC analyst fired for blaming Charlie Kirk for his own death
description: MSNBC dismissed veteran political analyst Matthew Dowd after he made controversial remarks following the fatal shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. Dowd suggested Kirk's rhetoric contributed to the environment leading to his death, sparking widespread condemnation. Despite a swift apology from MSNBC and Dowd's clarification, his contract was terminated immediately, highlighting tensions in media coverage of politically charged incidents.

title: Gemini app tops 10M users: Nano Banana fuels buzz; viral prompts to try
description: Google's Gemini app, featuring the AI image editing tool Nano Banana, has achieved over 10 million downloads shortly after its launch. Users have already created or modified over 200 million images, leveraging Nano Banana's speed and accuracy. Viral trends showcase the tool's versatility, allowing users to transform themselves into action figures, appear in different decades, and step into famous artworks.
